humanum_full_description_en:
From " not ", from " positive ", the original meaning is skewed, incorrect, and " positive ". "Shuowenâ€§ Libu": "ç«µ, it's not correct. Congli. Sound." Duan Yucai's note: "vulgar characters are crooked." Yuan Ma Zhiyuan "Remnant songâ€§ Ji Xianbin": "Cool Yin makes the poem stable, busy The writing is crooked."

" Crooked " can mean improper and unfair. "Water Margin" Chapter 94: "There is a perverted scholarship in this department. Who is the surname?"

" Crooked " can mean lying on your side. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 89: "Speaking, I walked into the inner room and crowed on the bed, slowly thinking about it."

crooked
wÄi
Incorrect, skewed: skewed. Distortion (q?).
Improper, unfair: perverted reasoning. Crooked poems. Crooked talent. unhealthy trend.
Rest on your side: I'll be tilted for a while.

["Words" Wu Guaiqie]
(1) Incorrect; oblique; skewed.
(2) Improper; improper.
(3) It is called side lying.
(4) Dialects. Frame up and shift the responsibility to others.
(5) Dialects. Barbaric.
(6) Dialects. exceed.
